headline: Netanyahu approves a $35 billion natural gas export deal to Egypt, the biggest in Israeli history
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday that he has approved a $35 billion natural gas export deal to Egypt, the biggest gas deal in Israeli history.  The gas will be delivered to Egypt over the next 15 years by U.S. energy giant Chevron, a key owner of the gas field off Israel's coast in the Mediterranean Sea.  Half of the proceeds are expected to go to Israel’s state coffers.

headline: Chevron (CVX) Highlighted in Mizuho’s 2026 Energy Outlook
summary: Chevron Corporation (NYSE:CVX) is included among the 12 Best Dogs of the Dow to Invest in. On December 12, Mizuho boosted its price target on Chevron Corporation (NYSE:CVX) up to $206 from $204 and kept an Outperform rating. The update came as part of the firm’s broader 2026 outlook for the exploration and production space. […]

headline: Trump Orders Blockade of Sanctioned Oil Tankers in Venezuela
summary: President Donald Trump ordered a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers going into and leaving Venezuela, ratcheting up pressure on Caracas as the US builds up its military presence in the region.  “Venezuela is completely surrounded by the largest Armada ever assembled in the History of South America,” Trump wrote on social media Tuesday.

headline: How Recent Catalysts Are Shifting the Chevron Narrative for Free Cash Flow and Growth
summary: Chevron's updated narrative reflects a slightly lower fair value estimate of about $172.33 per share and a marginally reduced revenue growth outlook, even as Street research remains broadly constructive on the stock. The small downward tweaks largely capture softer macro assumptions and long duration price inputs that temper upside, while still acknowledging strong execution, rising free cash flow visibility, and robust capital returns. Stay tuned to see how you can monitor these evolving...
